alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 11:54PM PDT until September 02 at 4:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Inyo County in south central California... * Until 400 AM PDT. * At 1154 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms producing heavy rain across parts of southern portion of Death Valley National Park. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... State Route 127 between Death Valley Junction and Shoshone FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
